results.title: South Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Visit the rich, fertile Barossa Valley, trek into the outback, enjoy the spectacular view from Mt Lofty House in the Adelaide Hills beautifully restored after the 1983 Ash Wednesday bush fires, visit the Gawler Ranges and the seaside town of Victor Harbour, charter a yacht at Port Lincoln, explore the heritage buildings in the mining town of Burra, journey by train from Adelaide to Alice Springs on the legendary Ghan, stay in an underground hotel in the opal mining town of Coober Pedy and finally enjoy a boat trip at Coorong.

results.title: The General. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Film Classics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version of Clyde Bruckman and Buster Keaton’s 1926 comedy feature, showing Buster Keaton in his most successful period as an actor and director of this satire on Civil War espionage. Combines good examples of Keaton’s dry wit and acute sense of timing. This edited work, narrated by Paul Killiam, indicates the significance of ‘The General’ in film history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Film Classics

results.title: Yankee clipper. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille, Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
William Boyd, a popular star even in those days before his portrayal of Hopalong Cassidy, is seen in a condensed version of the 1927 adventure romance film produced by Cecil B. De Mille. Boyd stars as the captain of an American clipper that outruns the British to win the China tea trade.

results.title: William S. Hart
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Presents highlights from the finest films of William S. Hart who grew up in the west and reflected in his films the real west. Includes excerpts from his outstanding features “Tumbleweeds” and “Hell’s Hinges” and is climaxed by Hart’s own moving farewell to the screen shortly before his death. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: Variety. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version for the History of the Motion Picture series of the German film “Variety” produced by Ufa and directed by E.A. Dupont in 1925. The revolutionary photographic techniques of this important and influential German film had a profound effect on filmmaking everywhere. A strong stark drama of human passions set against a circus and vaudeville background. It is generally considered to be the best film of both its star, Emil Jannings, and its director, E.A. Dupont. Silent film with music and story line narration added.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.

results.title: The Three musketeers. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”
An edited version of the 1921 silent film version of the Dumas novel starring Douglas Fairbanks in the role of D’Artagnan, with added commentary. A cloak-and-dagger adventure romance with sequences of lively duels, chases and acrobatics, and the drama of court intrigue, illustrating the silent action film at its best, adaptation of a popular novel to the screen, and the work of Fairbanks.

results.title: The Story of the serials
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Excerpts from famous silent serials - including “The Perils of Pauline” and even earlier productions - succeed in recapturing the atmosphere of those early thrillers. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: Australian Capital Territory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Australia’s capital city, although relatively young, offers a range of cultural, historical and natural attractions. Enjoy panoramic views of Canberra from a hot air balloon, a ride into Snowy River country, a 4WD adventure through the ACT or a coach tour to the War Memorial, the National Film and Sound Archive, Parliament House or the National Art Gallery.

results.title: Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Beginning with Brisbane’s elegant houses, this Queensland travel video also moves inland and along the expansive coastline. Enjoy the recreational activities on Hamilton Island, join a backpack tour that includes scuba diving, bush walking and horse riding, experience the Stockman’s Hall of Fame and the waterhole which inspired the Waltzing Matilda legend, visit the beaches of Surfer’s Paradise and Noosa, kayak in the Daintree Forest or sail to tranquil locations in the Whitsuday Islands.
